Posts.Content: ??Edit!!! 36 TREATMENTS! Not weeks....thank God. Sorry for any confusion!
Posts.Title: new to the board question about vitamins to help keep bones healthy during radiation

Posts.Content: Hello, I'm 47 Dx: L breast IDC Stage 1, Grade 1 - PR/ER+ HER2 -, two lymph nodes removed (neg) Lumpectomy and SNB Aug 2015 Currently undergoing 36 weeks ( to start) of whole breast radiation. What, if anything, has anyone done or suggests discussing, with the radiation oncologist re: vitamins, foods to eat, etc. to help keep the bones (especially rib bones) from being so brittle post radiation? My doc said they can break easily up to five years post radiation. I've read other threads here that say broken ribs remain broken ribs. They really don't heal? Just trying to be proactive. Also, my doc said no deoderant, no shaving on that side duing the entire radiation process....until it's done. Thoughts? Thanks!
Posts.Title: new to the board question about vitamins to help keep bones healthy during radiation
new to the board question about vitamins to help keep bones healthy during radiation

Posts.Content: You are your own best advocate. Seek another opinion. Bring all your scans, doctors breast notes, etc. if you can't afford it, reach out to a local breast cancer foundation (Gloria Gemma, Susan Komen, etc) Good luck, you'll be in my prayers!
Posts.Title: abnormal MRI, MAMMOGRAM insisting I'm fine
